result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Christine Raymond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall pay restitution if any is requested within 60 days.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant shall submit to random, observed drug testing for alcohol and controlled substances upon request of law enforcement, DOC, or designee.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla Christine Raymond

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kayla Christine Raymond in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Kayla Christine Raymond.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to charge. State recommends 60 days in jail consecutive to other imposed sentences, DNA, and pay courts costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Defendant hard. Court heard and orders 3 years probation with the following conditions: to have such assessment, counseling, treatment, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, not to possess or consume any alcohol, not to possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed, to submit to random, observed testing for alcohol and controlled substances upon request of law enforcement, DOC, or designee, to pay restitution in any is requested within 60 days, to pay court costs, and to provide a DNA sample.

Defendant Kayla Christine Raymond in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Kayla Christine Raymond.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richards requests plea and sentencing date. Court sets plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kayla Christine Raymond appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Kayla Christine Raymond. Christopher French sworn and testified. Exhibit #1: Report- offered and received. Cross. State heard and requests bind over. Attorney Richards heard. Court finds probable cause to bind over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kayla Christine Raymond in court, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant is referred to SPD. State requests signature bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond. Status date set.
